intro: Monanthotaxis filipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed monanthotaxis, is a tropical climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
